speaker: Susan
content: Hi, Mike. I brought you a litter house-warming gift. I probably should've brought something by earlier, but...
mark: bring sb sth 给某人带来某物，双宾结构
by earlier 早些时候的

speaker: Mike
content: Actually, you're the first neighborhood to stop by.
mark: you're the first one to do sth 你是第一个做某事的人
stop by 顺便拜访

speaker: Susan
content: Really?

speaker: Alice
content: Susan knew she was lucky. An eligible bachelor had moved onto Wisteria Lane. and she was the first to find out.
mark: eligible 符合条件的，合格的；（婚姻）合适的，合意的
bachelor 未婚男子，单身汉；学士
find out 发现，查明

speaker: Alice
content: But she also knew that good news travels quickly.
mark: Good news travels quickly 好事传千里

speaker: Eddie
content: Hello, there.

speaker: Alice
content: Eddie Britt was the most predatory divorcee in a five-block radius
mark: predatory adj. 捕食性的，食肉的；掠夺性的，弱肉强食的
divorcee 离了婚的人
radius 半径；半径范围，周围
in a + 数量词 + radius（of...）在…… 半径范围内；描述某个区域范围

speaker: Alice
content: Her conquests were numerous, varied and legendary.
mark: conquest 掠夺物 征服，占领；占领地，征服的土地；克服，攻克；爱情的俘虏
numerous 众多的，许多的
varied 各种各样的，形形色色的；多变的；杂色的
legendary 非常有名的，大名鼎鼎的；传说（中）的

speaker: Eddie
content: I hope I'm not interrupting. You must be Mike Delfino. Hi, I'm Eddie Britt. I live over there. Welcome to Wisteria Lane.
mark: over there 方位副词短语，在那边；在那里

speaker: Alice
content: Susan had met the enemy. And she was a slut.
mark: enemy 敌人，反对者；敌国，敌军；大敌，危害物
slut 荡妇；懒妇；母狗

speaker: Mike
content: Thank you. What's this?

speaker: Eddie
content: Sausage puttanesca. It's just something I threw together.
mark: Sausage 香肠腊肠 puttanesca 普塔内斯卡（酱），是一种源自意大利那不勒斯的经典意面酱Sausage puttanesca 茄汁香肠
throw together 快速组装，没有精度

speaker: Mike
content: Thanks, Eddie. That's great. I'd invite you both in, but I was sort of in the middle of something.
mark: invite sb in 邀请某人进来
sort of 有点儿 sorta: [美俚](=sort of)
in the middle of something 中途忙于做某事

speaker: Susan
content: I'm late for an appointment anyway.
mark: be late for 做某事迟到；赶不上……
appointment 约会，约定；任命，委派；职务，职位；家具，陈设
anyway 不管怎样，无论如何；而且，加之；尽管，即使这样；对了，好吧

speaker: Eddie
content: No problem, I just wanted to say hi.

speaker: Alice
content: And just like that, the race for Mike Delfino had begun.
mark: race n. 赛跑，速度竞赛；竞争，角逐；v. （和……）比赛，参加比赛；
the race for 为…… 而进行的竞争

speaker: Alice
content: For a moment, Susan wondered if her rivalry with Eddie would remain friendly.
mark: rivalry 竞争，较量
would更倾向于对未来情况的猜测，could 侧重于对当下可能性的疑惑

speaker: Alice
content: But she was reminded that when it came to men - women don't fight fair.
mark: when it came to sb/sth 当涉及到……；当谈到……；一提到……，通常用于引出某个特定的话题
fight fair 公平竞争

speaker: Eddie
content: Oh, Mike. I heard you're a plumber. Do you think you could stop by later tonight and take a look at my pipes?
mark: take a look at sth 仔细检查某物

speaker: Mike
content: Sure.
